ThingDef.label: Rowlet
ThingDef.description: It feels relaxed in tight, dark places and has been known to use its Trainer’s pocket or bag as a nest.\nIt sends its feathers, which are as sharp as blades, flying in attack. Its legs are strong, so its kicks are also formidable.

ThingDef.label: Dartrix
ThingDef.description: Supremely sensitive to the presence of others, it can detect opponents standing behind it, flinging its sharp feathers to take them out.\nThis narcissistic Pokémon is a clean freak. If you don’t groom it diligently, it will stop listening to you.

ThingDef.label: Decidueye
ThingDef.description: Decidueye can nock and fire an arrow at an enemy in a tenth of a second, so its battles are decided in the blink of an eye.\nIt nocks its arrow quills and shoots them at opponents. When it simply can’t afford to miss, it tugs the vine on its head to improve its focus.

ThingDef.label: Litten
ThingDef.description: Its coat regrows twice a year. When the time comes, Litten sets its own body on fire and burns away the old fur.\nIf you try too hard to get close to it, it won’t open up to you. Even if you do grow close, giving it too much affection is still a no-no.

ThingDef.label: Torracat
ThingDef.description: When its mane is standing on end, you can tell it’s feeling good. When it isn’t feeling well, its fur will lie down flat.\nIt can act spoiled if it grows close to its Trainer. A powerful Pokémon, its sharp claws can leave its Trainer’s whole body covered in scratches.

ThingDef.label: Incineroar
ThingDef.description: When its fighting spirit is set alight, the flames around its waist become especially intense.\nAlthough it’s rough mannered and egotistical, it finds beating down unworthy opponents boring. It gets motivated for stronger opponents.

ThingDef.label: Popplio
ThingDef.description: Popplio gets on top of its bouncy water balloons to jump higher. It’s quite the acrobatic fighter!\nThe balloons it inflates with its nose grow larger and larger as it practices day by day.

ThingDef.label: Brionne
ThingDef.description: It attacks by smacking its enemies with the exploding water balloons that it creates.\nIt gets excited when it sees a dance it doesn’t know. This hard worker practices diligently until it can learn that dance.

ThingDef.label: Primarina
ThingDef.description: Also known as a songstress, it has a fantastical look on moonlit nights when it leads its colony in song.\nTo Primarina, every battle is a stage. It takes down its prey with beautiful singing and dancing.

ThingDef.label: Pikipek
ThingDef.description: It may look spindly, but its neck muscles are heavy-duty. It can peck at a tree 16 times per second!\nIt pecks at trees with its hard beak. You can get some idea of its mood or condition from the rhythm of its pecking.

ThingDef.label: Trumbeak
ThingDef.description: From its mouth, it fires the seeds of berries it has eaten. The scattered seeds give rise to new plants.\nIt can bend the tip of its beak to produce over a hundred different cries at will.

ThingDef.label: Toucannon
ThingDef.description: Known for forming harmonious couples, this Pokémon is brought to wedding ceremonies as a good luck charm.\nThey smack beaks with others of their kind to communicate. The strength and number of hits tell each other how they feel.

ThingDef.label: Yungoos
ThingDef.description: Although it will eat anything, it prefers fresh living things, so it marches down streets in search of prey.\nIts stomach takes up most of its long torso. It’s a big eater, so the amount Trainers have to spend on its food is no laughing matter.

ThingDef.label: Gumshoos
ThingDef.description: Patient by nature, this Pokémon loses control of itself and pounces when it spots its favorite meal—Rattata!\nAlthough it wasn’t originally found in Alola, this Pokémon was brought over a long time ago when there was a huge Rattata outbreak.

ThingDef.label: Grubbin
ThingDef.description: It uses its big jaws to dig nests into the forest floor, and it loves to feed on sweet tree sap.\nIts natural enemies, like Rookidee, may flee rather than risk getting caught in its large mandibles that can snap thick tree branches.

ThingDef.label: Charjabug
ThingDef.description: Its digestive processes convert the leaves it eats into electricity. An electric sac in its belly stores the electricity for later use.\nWhile its durable shell protects it from attacks, Charjabug strikes at enemies with jolts of electricity discharged from the tips of its jaws.

ThingDef.label: Vikavolt
ThingDef.description: If it carries a Charjabug to use as a spare battery, a flying Vikavolt can rapidly fire high-powered beams of electricity.\nIt builds up electricity in its abdomen, focuses it through its jaws, and then fires the electricity off in concentrated beams.

ThingDef.label: Crabrawler
ThingDef.description: Crabrawler has been known to mistake Exeggutor for a coconut tree and climb it. The enraged Exeggutor shakes it off and stomps it.\nIts hard pincers are well suited to both offense and defense. Fights between two Crabrawler are like boxing matches.

ThingDef.label: Crabominable
ThingDef.description: Before it stops to think, it just starts pummeling. There are records of its turning back avalanches with a flurry of punches.\nIt stores coldness in its pincers and pummels its foes. It can even smash thick walls of ice to bits!

ThingDef.label: Oricorio
ThingDef.description: This Oricorio has drunk red nectar. If its Trainer gives the wrong order, this passionate Pokémon becomes fiercely angry.\nIt wins the hearts of its enemies with its passionate dancing and then uses the opening it creates to burn them up with blazing flames.

ThingDef.label: Cutiefly
ThingDef.description: An opponent’s aura can tell Cutiefly what that opponent’s next move will be. Then Cutiefly can glide around the attack and strike back.\nNectar and pollen are its favorite fare. You can find Cutiefly hovering around Gossifleur, trying to get some of Gossifleur’s pollen.

ThingDef.label: Ribombee
ThingDef.description: Ribombee absolutely hate getting wet or rained on. In the cloudy Galar region, they are very seldom seen.\nIt makes pollen puffs from pollen and nectar. The puffs’ effects depend on the type of ingredients and how much of each one is used.

ThingDef.label: Rockruff
ThingDef.description: This Pokémon intimidates opponents by striking the ground with the rocks on its neck. The moment an opponent flinches, Rockruff attacks.\nThis Pokémon can bond very strongly with its Trainer, but it also has a habit of biting. Raising a Rockruff for a long time can be challenging.

ThingDef.label: Lycanroc
ThingDef.description: With swift movements, this Pokémon gradually backs its prey into a corner. Lycanroc’s fangs are always aimed toward opponents’ weak spots.\nThis Lycanroc is calm and cautious. The rocks jutting from its mane are razor sharp.

ThingDef.label: Wishiwashi
ThingDef.description: When it senses danger, its eyes tear up. The sparkle of its tears signals other Wishiwashi to gather.\nIndividually, they’re incredibly weak. It’s by gathering up into schools that they’re able to confront opponents.

ThingDef.label: Mareanie
ThingDef.description: Unlike their Alolan counterparts, the Mareanie of the Galar region have not yet figured out that the branches of Corsola are delicious.\nThe first symptom of its sting is numbness. The next is an itching sensation so intense that it’s impossible to resist the urge to claw at your skin.

ThingDef.label: Toxapex
ThingDef.description: Within the poison sac in its body is a poison so toxic that Pokémon as large as Wailord will still be suffering three days after it first takes effect.\nTo survive in the cold waters of Galar, this Pokémon forms a dome with its legs, enclosing its body so it can capture its own body heat.

ThingDef.label: Mudbray
ThingDef.description: It eats dirt to create mud and smears this mud all over its feet, giving them the grip needed to walk on rough terrain without slipping.\nLoads weighing up to 50 times as much as its own body weight pose no issue for this Pokémon. It’s skilled at making use of mud.

ThingDef.label: Mudsdale
ThingDef.description: Mudsdale has so much stamina that it could carry over 10 tons across the Galar region without rest or sleep.\nMud that hardens around a Mudsdale’s legs sets harder than stone. It’s so hard that it allows this Pokémon to scrap a truck with a single kick.

ThingDef.label: Dewpider
ThingDef.description: Dewpider normally lives underwater. When it comes onto land in search of food, it takes water with it in the form of a bubble on its head.\nIt forms a water bubble at the rear of its body and then covers its head with it. Meeting another Dewpider means comparing water-bubble sizes.

ThingDef.label: Araquanid
ThingDef.description: It acts as a caretaker for Dewpider, putting them inside its bubble and letting them eat any leftover food.\nIt launches water bubbles with its legs, drowning prey within the bubbles. This Pokémon can then take its time to savor its meal.

ThingDef.label: Fomantis
ThingDef.description: During the day, Fomantis basks in sunlight and sleeps peacefully. It wakes and moves around at night.\nWhen bathed in sunlight, this Pokémon emits a pleasantly sweet scent, which causes bug Pokémon to gather around it.

ThingDef.label: Lurantis
ThingDef.description: The petals on this Pokémon’s arms are thin and super sharp, and they can fire laser beams if Lurantis gathers light first.\nThis Pokémon resembles a beautiful flower. A properly raised Lurantis will have gorgeous, brilliant colors.

ThingDef.label: Morelull
ThingDef.description: Morelull live in forests that stay dark even during the day. They scatter flickering spores that put enemies to sleep.\nPokémon living in the forest eat the delicious caps on Morelull’s head. The caps regrow overnight.

ThingDef.label: Shiinotic
ThingDef.description: If you see a light deep in a forest at night, don’t go near. Shiinotic will make you fall fast asleep.\nIts flickering spores lure in prey and put them to sleep. Once this Pokémon has its prey snoozing, it drains their vitality with its fingertips.

ThingDef.label: Salandit
ThingDef.description: This sneaky Pokémon will slink behind its prey and immobilize it with poisonous gas before the prey even realizes Salandit is there.\nIts venom sacs produce a fluid that this Pokémon then heats up with the flame in its tail. This process creates Salandit’s poisonous gas.

ThingDef.label: Salazzle
ThingDef.description: The winner of competitions between Salazzle is decided by which one has the most male Salandit with it.\nOnly female Salazzle exist. They emit a gas laden with pheromones to captivate male Salandit.

ThingDef.label: Stufful
ThingDef.description: The way it protects itself by flailing its arms may be an adorable sight, but stay well away. This is flailing that can snap thick tree trunks.\nIts fluffy fur is a delight to pet, but carelessly reaching out to touch this Pokémon could result in painful retaliation.

ThingDef.label: Bewear
ThingDef.description: The moves it uses to take down its prey would make a martial artist jealous. It tucks subdued prey under its arms to carry them to its nest.\nOnce it accepts you as a friend, it tries to show its affection with a hug. Letting it do that is dangerous—it could easily shatter your bones.

ThingDef.label: Bounsweet
ThingDef.description: When under attack, it secretes a sweet and delicious sweat. The scent only calls more enemies to it.\nIts body gives off a sweet, fruity scent that is extremely appetizing to bird Pokémon.

ThingDef.label: Steenee
ThingDef.description: Any Corvisquire that pecks at this Pokémon will be greeted with a smack from its sepals followed by a sharp kick.\nAs it twirls like a dancer, a sweet smell spreads out around it. Anyone who inhales the scent will feel a surge of happiness.

ThingDef.label: Tsareena
ThingDef.description: A kick from the hardened tips of this Pokémon’s legs leaves a wound in the opponent’s body and soul that will never heal.\nThis feared Pokémon has long, slender legs and a cruel heart. It shows no mercy as it stomps on its opponents.

ThingDef.label: Comfey
ThingDef.description: These Pokémon smell very nice. All Comfey wear different flowers, so each of these Pokémon has its own individual scent.\nComfey picks flowers with its vine and decorates itself with them. For some reason, flowers won’t wither once they’re attached to a Comfey.

ThingDef.label: Oranguru
ThingDef.description: It knows the forest inside and out. If it comes across a wounded Pokémon, Oranguru will gather medicinal herbs to treat it.\nWith waves of its fan—made from leaves and its own fur—Oranguru skillfully gives instructions to other Pokémon.

ThingDef.label: Passimian
ThingDef.description: Passimian live in groups of about 20, with each member performing an assigned role. Through cooperation, the group survives.\nDisplaying amazing teamwork, they follow the orders of their boss as they all help out in the search for their favorite berries.

ThingDef.label: Wimpod
ThingDef.description: Wimpod gather in swarms, constantly on the lookout for danger. They scatter the moment they detect an enemy’s presence.\nIt’s nature’s cleaner—it eats anything and everything, including garbage and rotten things. The ground near its nest is always clean.

ThingDef.label: Golisopod
ThingDef.description: They live in sunken ships or in holes in the seabed. When Golisopod and Grapploct battle, the loser becomes the winner’s meal.\nIt will do anything to win, taking advantage of every opening and finishing opponents off with the small claws on its front legs.

ThingDef.label: Sandygast
ThingDef.description: Sandygast mainly inhabits beaches. It takes control of anyone who puts their hand into its mouth, forcing them to make its body bigger.\nGrudges of the dead have possessed a mound of sand and become a Pokémon. Sandygast is fond of the shovel on its head.

ThingDef.label: Palossand
ThingDef.description: This Pokémon lives on beaches, but it hates water. Palossand can’t maintain its castle-like shape if it gets drenched by a heavy rain.\nPalossand is known as the Beach Nightmare. It pulls its prey down into the sand by controlling the sand itself, and then it sucks out their souls.

ThingDef.label: Pyukumuku
ThingDef.description: It’s covered in a slime that keeps its skin moist, allowing it to stay on land for days without drying up.\nIt lives in warm, shallow waters. If it encounters a foe, it will spit out its internal organs as a means to punch them.

ThingDef.label: Type: Null
ThingDef.description: It was modeled after a mighty Pokémon of myth. The mask placed upon it limits its power in order to keep it under control.\nRumor has it that the theft of top-secret research notes led to a new instance of this Pokémon being created in the Galar region.

ThingDef.label: Silvally
ThingDef.description: The final factor needed to release this Pokémon’s true power was a strong bond with a Trainer it trusts.\nA solid bond of trust between this Pokémon and its Trainer awakened the strength hidden within Silvally. It can change its type at will.

ThingDef.label: Minior
ThingDef.description: Although its outer shell is uncommonly durable, the shock of falling to the ground smashes the shell to smithereens.\nIt lives in the ozone layer, where it becomes food for stronger Pokémon. When it tries to run away, it falls to the ground.

ThingDef.label: Komala
ThingDef.description: It remains asleep from birth to death as a result of the sedative properties of the leaves that form its diet.\nIt stays asleep from the moment it’s born. When it falls into a deep sleep, it stops moving altogether.

ThingDef.label: Turtonator
ThingDef.description: Eating sulfur in its volcanic habitat is what causes explosive compounds to develop in its shell. Its droppings are also dangerously explosive.\nExplosive substances coat the shell on its back. Enemies that dare attack it will be blown away by an immense detonation.

ThingDef.label: Togedemaru
ThingDef.description: When it’s in trouble, it curls up into a ball, makes its fur spikes stand on end, and then discharges electricity indiscriminately.\nWith the long hairs on its back, this Pokémon takes in electricity from other electric Pokémon. It stores what it absorbs in an electric sac.

ThingDef.label: Mimikyu
ThingDef.description: There was a scientist who peeked under Mimikyu’s old rag in the name of research. The scientist died of a mysterious disease.\nIt wears a rag fashioned into a Pikachu costume in an effort to look less scary. Unfortunately, the costume only makes it creepier.

ThingDef.label: Bruxish
ThingDef.description: Its skin is thick enough to fend off Mareanie’s spikes. With its robust teeth, Bruxish crunches up the spikes and eats them.\nIt burrows beneath the sand, radiating psychic power from the protuberance on its head. It waits for prey as it surveys the area.

ThingDef.label: Drampa
ThingDef.description: Drampa is a kind and friendly Pokémon—up until it’s angered. When that happens, it stirs up a gale and flattens everything around.\nThe mountains it calls home are nearly two miles in height. On rare occasions, it descends to play with the children living in the towns below.

ThingDef.label: Dhelmise
ThingDef.description: After lowering its anchor, it waits for its prey. It catches large Wailord and drains their life-force.\nAfter a piece of seaweed merged with debris from a sunken ship, it was reborn as this ghost Pokémon.

ThingDef.label: Jangmo-o
ThingDef.description: Jangmo-o strikes its scales to communicate with others of its kind. Its scales are actually fur that’s become as hard as metal.\nThey learn to fight by smashing their head scales together. The dueling strengthens both their skills and their spirits.

ThingDef.label: Hakamo-o
ThingDef.description: Before attacking its enemies, it clashes its scales together and roars. Its sharp claws shred the opposition.\nThe scaleless, scarred parts of its body are signs of its strength. It shows them off to defeated opponents.

ThingDef.label: Kommo-o
ThingDef.description: Certain ruins have paintings of ancient warriors wearing armor made of Kommo-o scales.\nIt clatters its tail scales to unnerve opponents. This Pokémon will battle only those who stand steadfast in the face of this display.

ThingDef.label: Tapu Koko
ThingDef.description: The lightning-wielding guardian deity of Melemele, Tapu Koko is brimming with curiosity and appears before people from time to time.\nAlthough it’s called a guardian deity, if a person or Pokémon puts it in a bad mood, it will become a malevolent deity and attack.

ThingDef.label: Tapu Lele
ThingDef.description: Although called a guardian deity, Tapu Lele is devoid of guilt about its cruel disposition and can be described as nature incarnate.\nIt heals the wounds of people and Pokémon by sprinkling them with its sparkling scales. This guardian deity is worshiped on Akala.

ThingDef.label: Tapu Bulu
ThingDef.description: It makes ringing sounds with its tail to let others know where it is, avoiding unneeded conflicts. This guardian deity of Ula’ula controls plants.\nAlthough it’s called a guardian deity, it’s violent enough to crush anyone it sees as an enemy.

ThingDef.label: Tapu Fini
ThingDef.description: Although it’s called a guardian deity, terrible calamities sometimes befall those who recklessly approach Tapu Fini.\nThis guardian deity of Poni Island manipulates water. Because it lives deep within a thick fog, it came to be both feared and revered.

ThingDef.label: Cosmog
ThingDef.description: Whether or not it’s a Pokémon from this world is a mystery. When it’s in a jam, it warps away to a safe place to hide.\nEven though its helpless, gaseous body can be blown away by the slightest breeze, it doesn’t seem to care.

ThingDef.label: Cosmoem
ThingDef.description: As it absorbs light, Cosmoem continues to grow. Its golden shell is surprisingly solid.\nThe king who ruled Alola in times of antiquity called it the “cocoon of the stars” and built an altar to worship it.

ThingDef.label: Solgaleo
ThingDef.description: In writings from the distant past, it’s called by the name “the beast that devours the sun.”\nSometimes the result of its opening an Ultra Wormhole is that energy and life-forms from other worlds are called here to this world.

ThingDef.label: Lunala
ThingDef.description: It sometimes summons unknown powers and life-forms here to this world from holes that lead to other worlds.\nRecords of it exist in writings from long, long ago, where it was known by the name “the beast that calls the moon.”

ThingDef.label: Nihilego
ThingDef.description: It appeared in this world from an Ultra Wormhole. Nihilego appears to be a parasite that lives by feeding on people and Pokémon.\nA life-form from another world, it was dubbed a UB and is thought to produce a strong neurotoxin.

ThingDef.label: Buzzwole
ThingDef.description: Buzzwole goes around showing off its abnormally swollen muscles. It is one kind of Ultra Beast.\nAlthough it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.

ThingDef.label: Pheromosa
ThingDef.description: Although it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.\nA life-form that lives in another world, its body is thin and supple, but it also possesses great power.

ThingDef.label: Xurkitree
ThingDef.description: They’ve been dubbed Ultra Beasts. Some of them stand unmoving, like trees, with their arms and legs stuck into the ground.\nAlthough it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.

ThingDef.label: Celesteela
ThingDef.description: Although it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.\nOne of the dangerous UBs, high energy readings can be detected coming from both of its huge arms.

ThingDef.label: Kartana
ThingDef.description: Although it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.\nThis Ultra Beast’s body, which is as thin as paper, is like a sharpened sword.

ThingDef.label: Guzzlord
ThingDef.description: An unknown life-form called a UB. It may be constantly hungry—it is certainly always devouring something.\nAlthough it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.

ThingDef.label: Necrozma
ThingDef.description: Light is the source of its energy. If it isn’t devouring light, impurities build up in it and on it, and Necrozma darkens and stops moving.\nIt looks somehow pained as it rages around in search of light, which serves as its energy. It’s apparently from another world.

ThingDef.label: Magearna
ThingDef.description: Built roughly 500 years ago by a scientist, the part called the Soul-Heart is the actual life-form.\nIt synchronizes its consciousness with others to understand their feelings. This faculty makes it useful for taking care of people.

ThingDef.label: Marshadow
ThingDef.description: It sinks into the shadows of people and Pokémon, where it can understand their feelings and copy their capabilities.\nIt slips into the shadows of others and mimics their powers and movements. As it improves, it becomes stronger than those it’s imitating.

ThingDef.label: Poipole
ThingDef.description: An Ultra Beast that lives in a different world, it cackles wildly as it sprays its opponents with poison from the needles on its head.\nThis Ultra Beast is well enough liked to be chosen as a first partner in its own world.

ThingDef.label: Naganadel
ThingDef.description: One kind of Ultra Beast, it fires a glowing, venomous liquid from its needles. This liquid is also immensely adhesive.\nIt stores hundreds of liters of poisonous liquid inside its body. It is one of the organisms known as UBs.

ThingDef.label: Stakataka
ThingDef.description: When stone walls started moving and attacking, the brute’s true identity was this mysterious life-form, which brings to mind an Ultra Beast.\nIt appeared from an Ultra Wormhole. Each one appears to be made up of many life-forms stacked one on top of each other.

ThingDef.label: Blacephalon
ThingDef.description: A UB that appeared from an Ultra Wormhole, it causes explosions, then takes advantage of opponents’ surprise to rob them of their vitality.\nIt slithers toward people. Then, without warning, it triggers the explosion of its own head. It’s apparently one kind of Ultra Beast.

ThingDef.label: Zeraora
ThingDef.description: It approaches its enemies at the speed of lightning, then tears them limb from limb with its sharp claws.\nIt electrifies its claws and tears its opponents apart with them. Even if they dodge its attack, they’ll be electrocuted by the flying sparks.

ThingDef.label: Meltan
ThingDef.description: It melts particles of iron and other metals found in the subsoil, so it can absorb them into its body of molten steel.

ThingDef.label: Melmetal
ThingDef.description: Centrifugal force is behind the punches of Melmetal’s heavy hex-nut arms. Melmetal is said to deliver the strongest punches of all Pokémon.\nAt the end of its life-span, Melmetal will rust and fall apart. The small shards left behind will eventually be reborn as Meltan.
